document_notes.text:
This update for xorg-x11-server fixes the following issues:

  - CVE-2023-6816: Fixed heap buffer overflow in DeviceFocusEvent and ProcXIQueryPointer (bsc#1218582)
  - CVE-2024-0229: Fixed reattaching to different master device may lead to out-of-bounds memory access (bsc#1218583)
  - CVE-2024-21885: Fixed heap buffer overflow in XISendDeviceHierarchyEvent (bsc#1218584)
  - CVE-2024-21886: Fixed heap buffer overflow in DisableDevice (bsc#1218585)
document_notes.title: Details

SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5

notes.text: A flaw was found in X.Org server. Both DeviceFocusEvent and the XIQueryPointer reply contain a bit for each logical button currently down. Buttons can be arbitrarily mapped to any value up to 255, but the X.Org Server was only allocating space for the device's particular number of buttons, leading to a heap overflow if a bigger value was used.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

product_id: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 SP5:xorg-x11-server-1.19.6-10.65.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 SP5:xorg-x11-server-extra-1.19.6-10.65.1

SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5:xorg-x11-server-sdk-1.19.6-10.65.1

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the X.Org server. This issue can be triggered when a device frozen by a sync grab is reattached to a different master device. This issue may lead to an application crash, local privilege escalation (if the server runs with extended privileges), or remote code execution in SSH X11 forwarding environments.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: A flaw was found in X.Org server. In the XISendDeviceHierarchyEvent function, it is possible to exceed the allocated array length when certain new device IDs are added to the xXIHierarchyInfo struct. This can trigger a heap buffer overflow condition, which may lead to an application crash or remote code execution in SSH X11 forwarding environments.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

notes.text: A heap buffer overflow flaw was found in the DisableDevice function in the X.Org server. This issue may lead to an application crash or, in some circumstances, remote code execution in SSH X11 forwarding environments.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
